intro: Dactyliandra, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to tropical and southern Africa. The plants are typically shrubs or small trees with showy, clustered inflorescences that resemble daisies. They have simple, alternate leaves and produce small, white or yellow flowers. Dactyliandra species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and are adapted to grow in well-drained soils.
